isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Power Cylinders - Removal - Removing Piston and Connecting Rod Assembly

svcproc.title: Removing Piston and Connecting Rod Assembly

step1.para: Loosen both connecting rod bolts two turns.
Rock the two bolts on the rod cap to loosen.
Repeat procedure for all other connecting rods.
Rotate the engine to a vertical position with the front end up.

figure.caption: Removing connecting rod cap and bolts

step1.para: Unscrew the bolts completely. Remove the cap and bolts as a unit.

figure.caption: Pushing out piston and connecting rod assembly

step1.para: Do not push on rod fractured surface. Use a hammer with a plastic or wooden handle or a non-marring punch to push the piston out of the cylinder sleeve.

figure.caption: Removing piston and connecting rod assembly from cylinder sleeve

step1.para: Once the piston rings are free of the cylinder sleeve, remove the assembly from the top of the crankcase.
For installation purposes, mark each piston, connecting rod, and cap with the cylinder number from which it was removed. Also mark the front of each piston as it was installed in the engine.
